title: A horrific, yet beautifully poetic film about the desperation of addiction.
review: Wow! My wife will never let me pick the movie ever again. She actually said that after walking out at the end of this one.Aranofsky should be proud, however. I don't want to give away too much, but let's just say that the film pulls you in to the world of drug addiction in a gripping, sickening, and unrelenting manner. See it, but be warned--this is not the feel-good hit of the holiday season.Tremendous performances. Much more accessible than PI. And fast-paced editing and stylish camera work.Go watch the film--just don't see the film on a 'first date.'
